input.name: __VIEWSTATE

a.span: SEE THE PARENT & STUDENT INFORMATION PAGE

div.span: Coronavirus (COVID-19) information for Ohio's schools and districts:

strong.span: BELOW ARE ALL DISTRICT COMMUNICATIONS THAT HAVE BEEN SENT:

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Today, the Governor announced that all schools will remain closed due to COVID-19 and students will continue to be educated remotely through the end of the school year.Â The last official day of school is Friday, May 22, 2020.Â As we proceed into the final weeks and days of school, any changes which are implemented will be communicated toÂ you in a timely manner.Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: With the official closure of school buildings for the remainder of the year, we will now be able to make some final decisions on any remaining student activities and implement end of year procedures and item collections.Â Look for updates in the near future.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Stay Strong, Stay Safe, and Stay Healthy!

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span:
April 17, 2020
4:01 p.m. Email to parentsÂ Â OCS Families,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: As we complete the fifth week of Ohio's mandatory COVID-19 school closure, OCS continues to plan and implement ways to make every student's learning situation relevant and beneficial.Â There are five weeks left in our official school year.Â Our last day is officially May 22, 2020.Â Please continue to push forward and encourage your children to stay on task, complete assignments and activities to the best of their (and your) abilitiesÂ while staying healthy.Â We are half way home to summer break!

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Today,Â Governor Mike DeWine mentioned he is speaking to some Superintendents over the weekend and will make an announcementÂ whether to close schools the rest of the year orÂ return early next week.Â All signs point to keeping schools closed the rest of the year and OCS leadership isÂ planning accordingly.Â Of course, if students are able to return, OCS will be open and ready to go.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS will continue to provide meals throughout the duration of the school closure.Â Our meal program hasÂ increased weekly from 678 to 5,000 to 7,000 to 8,000 to 8,500 last Monday.Â To date, we have servedÂ 14,589 lunches and 14,589 breakfasts for a total of 29,178 meals.Â You can make a meal reservation by calling our hotline at 419-698-6030 or emailing us atÂ
.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Finally, however the school year ends, this year will be remembered for flexibility, frustration, uncertainty, on-line learning and video chats.Â We have all been on a steep learning curve.Â A continued THANK YOUÂ to all teachers, parents and care givers who are working hard and doing your best to help our students learn.Â We are all in this together!

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Stay Strong, Stay Safe, and Stay Healthy!

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: The past month has challenged all of us to be the "best versionsÂ of ourselves" and I have certainly seen a lot of support and positivity from our community and staff members.Â I applaud everyone for the efforts you have made, not only in our communities, but in the State of Ohio.Â We areÂ honoring the health mandates and doing the right things.Â We are all in this together!Â Thank you.Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Tomorrow, Tuesday, April 14,Â school will officially resume after our scheduled spring break.Â Our educational leadership team workingÂ with our teaching staff developing enhance internal guidance to bringÂ more consistency to our online education and student/parent communications.Â We hope to make the current learning experience even more productive and beneficial to all.Â Parents, please continue doing your part supporting your children's education and encouraging them to do their best completing lessons and activities.Â ThisÂ two-way commitment between school personnel and parents has never been more important.Â Thank you.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: There is still time to vote.Â Voting for the March Primary election has been extended through April 28, 2020.Â Please exercise your right to vote through the absentee ballot process on behalf of OCS.Â You can find information atÂ

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Finally, there continues to be uncertainty related to the length of the mandated school closure.Â Everyday, I get asked my opinion on school closing for the rest of the year.Â Of course I have no way of knowing for certain what will happen in the future, but either way, I will assure you we are ready for a continued closure through the end of the year, or a return to school in May based on the current mandate.Â We were able to initially prepare for the closure in less than 48 hours and we will be able to prepare for students to return in the same amount of time.Â Just like riding a bicycle.Â We have all become accustomed to making quick decisions and jumping into action. Please watch for district and school emails providing additional information about specifics moving forward.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Remember, for meal reservationsÂ or general questions, you can call our hotline atÂ
Â or email us atÂ
.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Stay strong, stay safe and stay healthy!

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS Families,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: On behalf of OCS, I want to wish everyone a safe and restful spring break.Â Spring Break officially starts next Monday, April 6, 2020 and goes to Tuesday, April 14, 2020.Â During this scheduled break, teachers are not required to provide instruction to students and students are not required to complete school work.Â With that said, I hope students and teachers can take this week to catch up on school work or anything necessary and take a much needed "breather" from all the tension and change going on in our lives.Â Of course the number one thing is to stay safe and healthy.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: When we officially return from break, teachers will resume their instruction and communications with you.Â We have learned a lot over this past three weeks, what works and what doesn't work.Â OCS leadership, along with teaching staff, haveÂ worked very hard to develop better processes and tools so students and families have less frustration and confusion moving forward.Â We know there will continue to be obstacles and unanticipated learning situations which come up and our OCS team will work hard to address them in a timely manner, so I askÂ all of us to remain flexible and understanding.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Finally, I thank and praise all the parents, grandparents, aunts, uncles, brothers, sisters, and friends who are trying their best helping children process this new type of learning and school engagement.Â We knowÂ it is hard, but hopefully a small bit rewarding.Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Stay strong, stay safe, and stay healthy!

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Yesterday, as expected,Â

span.strong: Ohio Governor Mike DeWine extended the school closure through May, 1, 2020

p.span: .Â OCS will continue to serve the educational needs of our students through various methods similar to what we are doing now.Â Please continue to encourage your children to put forth their best efforts given your individual family circumstance.Â We fully expect to provide credit to students in high school for the work studentsÂ are doing and do everything we can to not have anyone fall behind, but students need toÂ put forth effort to earn that credit.Â CommunicationÂ is key to everyone's success PreK-12.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS and the food service department will continue to provide meals each Monday during the duration of this mandated closure.Â We have provided over 12,000 meals already in the past few weeks and around 6000 meals each Monday.Â For a meal reservationÂ please emailÂ us atÂ
Â or callÂ our hotline atÂ
.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: I know there are still many unanswered questions like how we intend to handle graduation and the Washington DC trip to name a few.Â It is our full intention to honor our senior students through a graduation ceremony of some kind.Â It is our hopeÂ we can proceed as scheduled using the Seagate Center on May 31, 2020.Â We also understand this may not be an option if the current health mandates still exist.Â We will continue to keep you posted as circumstances change for all scheduled events.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Best wishes to all our families and please stay safe!Â Â

div.div:
March 25, 2020
4:18 p.m. Email to parentsÂ Â
OCS Families,
Thank you to everyone in our OCS Community who have stepped up to help and assist others in need.Â PeopleÂ are supporting each other like never before, even with the physical distancing mandate in place.Â I also want to thank all our OCS employees who continue to prepare and provide food, watch over our buildings, teach our students, and lead our staff through this unique time.Â Â
Every day at 2:00pm, Governor Mike DeWine holds a press conference updating the state on new mandates, statistics and updates.Â As of today, the mandatory school closure date has not yet been extended.Â Â If nothing changes, students will return to school on Tuesday, April 14, 2020 after our scheduled spring break.Â With that said, it is my opinion the school closure date may be extended. Today, the Governor mentioned he expects the Ohio COVID-19 virus to peak at the beginning of May so common sense says schools would not be in session during the peak of the virus.Â If and when an announcement is made, please know OCS is prepared to continue the educational process and following all guidance and mandates that come our way.Â
As you know, we have a levy on the June 2 ballot.Â Today, the state legislature voted toÂ provideÂ all registered voters an absentee ballot to vote by mail through AprilÂ 28.Â Please look for a post card from the Lucas County Board of Elections outlining the process to obtain an absentee ballot.Â PLEASE exercise your right to vote by mail on behalf of OCS prior to April 28, 2020.Â Â
In addition, the state legislatureÂ voted to waive state testing and report card requirements for the 19-20 school year and toÂ freeze the list of voucher-eligible school buildings rather than letting it expand to more than 1,200 next Wednesday.Â Â OCS will be evaluating how these decisions impact our senior students and all HS studentsÂ moving forward.
Meals will be served again next Monday, March 30, 2020 at Starr Elementary.Â If you already received meals you are on our list and do not need to make a reservation.Â If you have not received any meals yet, and would like too,Â please email us atÂ [emailÂ protected]Â or call our hotline at 419-698-6030.Â Â
Thank you and stay safe!
Hal Gregory
Superintendent
Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS Families,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: The Governor has issued a state wide order to have everyone stay at home. Â OCS employees are observing this order. Â But, meals will continue to be distributed. Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Just a reminder that âgrab and goâ meals (breakfast/lunch) are available for students tomorrow, Monday, March 23, 2020Â fromÂ

Â at Starr Elementary School. Â We are working off reservations which many have already done. Â You will receive meals for the entire week allowing us to only distribute meals one time per week for the safety of our employees and for our families. Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Meal reservations will be taken until 8am tomorrow morning, Monday. Â You can call the OCS Hotline atÂ
Â or email atÂ

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS is committed to supporting our community during this time of crisis. Â If there are any other general needs or questions you have please contact us on the same hotline or email and we will do what we can to help. Â We will monitor these lines at all times. Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Please comply withÂ all mandates and orders from the State of Ohio. Â We will all be better off if everyone fulfills their part.Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Entering the weekend there are not many new mandates or changes to our educational structure.Â The Governor mentioned, once again, the real possibility of a prolonged school closure.Â Â OCS continues to review our current instructional practices and brainstorm ways to make our system better for students, teachers, and families moving forward.Â There are so many individual situations and juggling all of these are a challenge for everyone.Â Flexibility andÂ understanding are key to the success of our educational program.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: I would ask all our parents to support our teachers byÂ encouragingÂ your children to work on their assignments and activities as best theyÂ can, particularly high school students.Â Â High schoolÂ students are the most vulnerable to not attempt or complete their assignments without parent nudging and the expectation of doing so.Â I know as a father, my direct involvement at the high school level was much lessÂ than when my kidsÂ wereÂ in the lower grades.Â Involvement is more important now than ever.Â We do expect students to complete work and put a good faith effort into it.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Thank you to all whoÂ have posted and shared the positive occurring in our community.Â Have a great weekend!

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Hal Gregory

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto

div.span: 12:22 p.m. Email to parentsÂ Â OCS Families,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: All school buildings, school officesÂ and central office will be closed to the public and most OCS employees until further notice.Â I have instructed ourÂ Leadership team and various support staffÂ to begin working from home starting Monday, March 23, 2020.Â Please stopÂ your calls to school offices moving forward.Â Email is theÂ best way to reach any specific individual including your building principal, teacher or director.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Technology/deviceÂ repairs will only happen on MondaysÂ by appointment only.Â Repair appointments should be scheduled by emailingÂ
.Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Although there are not many, any student device that has not been picked up, can ONLY be picked up onÂ

span.strong: Monday's between 9-1pm at Fassett JH Library.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Finally, the OCS Hotline is available for you to callÂ or email at anytime with questions or needs you have.Â The Hotline isÂ
Â or email atÂ

.Â You can use these lines for general questions or food requests.Â We are monitoring these lines on a regular basis.Â Keep in mind evening calls or emails may not be returned until the following morning.Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Stay Safe everyone!

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Hal Gregory

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span:
March 18, 2020
6:17 p.m. Email to parentsÂ Â OCS Families,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: On behalf of our entire OCS teaching staff and school leaders,Â

Â about your children(s) school work or not being able to help them right away or assignment completion timelines.Â We know many families are dealing with heavy issues like losing jobs, finding food, and uncertainty.Â School is important, but we all must use common sense and OCS understands reality.Â Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Between the end of last week and beginning of thisÂ week, our 270 teachers sent many emails and work assignments/activities out to you with the goal of keeping education running during this unique time in our history.Â It is a lot to digest for all of us.Â Rightly so,Â some students, parents, grandparents, and families are overwhelmed with the amount of work expected and itÂ is already increasing anxiety within families.Â I am telling you, we are all in this together and as a family, make decisions aboutÂ the amount of school work you can do on any given day based onÂ your family and job dynamics.Â We understand the completion of school work will vary per student based on unique family supports and circumstances.Â Â

span.strong: All we ask is studentsÂ give the work theirÂ best effort and all will be fine.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS is focused on feedback to students,Â not gradingÂ during these initial three weeks.Â I want to reassure you our teachers and leaders willÂ be flexible.Â We are already in the planning phase for a more systematic "roll out" of assignments and activities if/when there are more days added to this school closure.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Hal Gregory

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS Families,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: We are all going through emotional and trying times as the COVID-19 Pandemic causes us to change our daily lives in ways we never imagined.Â Public schools everywhere are playing a major role supporting the education of our children, but also supplying food to our most needy.Â Both are critical to our students and community to cope with all this overwhelming change in lifestyle and economics.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Oregon City Schools is providing food for our students.Â We have a plan in place to provide food (breakfast & lunch).Â As the days move on, our plan may change to meet the needs our students, but as of today here is the plan:

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: 1.Â To receive food for tomorrow and Friday you must call our hotline at
Â or email atÂ
Â to schedule food pick up at Clay High School.Â Â Â All food is free to our students.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: 2.Â OnÂ Mondays only (as of now), food will be distributed atÂ

Â from 10:00am to 12:00pm. Starr Elementary is located at 3230 Starr Ave., Oregon.Â Time may be extended due to volume.Â To help us out, please call the hotline or email (listed above) and let us know how many "grab and go" meals you will need.Â We are very unsure about the numbers on Monday so as many reservations we can get upfront will help.Â Anyone who comes on Monday willÂ

span.strong: receive enough breakfast & lunch meals for the entire week or five days.

p.span: Â We will not turn any student/family away.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto

span.strong: This week so far, we have provided 766 meals to 125 studentsÂ

p.span: and two days to go
Â Our food service department is awesome!Â Thank you Vicki Laurell, Dean Sandwisch and all the OCS proud cooks who are working their tail off to make this all happen.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Â Yesterday morning, Sheri Walters, long time OCS and Eisenhower teacher was killed in a car accident.Â We are all stunned and saddened by her passing.Â Mrs. Walters touched many many students lives throughout the years and will always be remembered for her love of teaching and students.Â She was a friend to many and someone who dedicated herself to the teaching profession.Â Please keep Mrs. Walters family in your thoughts.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Please watch for additional updates in coming days and remember, if you don't know where to go to ask a question please call the hotline at 419-698-6030 or email atÂ
Â and I promise we will respond in a timely manner to your outreach.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Hal Gregory

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS Families,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Here are some options for free and reduced Wi-Fi.Â You can also find this information and more technology related information on the OCS website at:Â Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto

ul.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto

li.span: -Â consumer home internet wireline & Fixed Wireless - unlimited internet data & will continue to offer internet access for qualifying limited income households at $10 a month through the Access from AT&T program.Â

a.span: CLICK HERE TO FIND OUT MORE ABOUT THIS PROGRAM

li.span: Â - Buckeye Broadband is currently working with local schools to provide a lifeline internet speed to students who are now homebound and unable to receive classroom lessons.Â This service is being offered to low income families, or families that require government assistance, and do not currently have internet in the home. In this case, Buckeye Broadband will provide an internet connection at no charge.Â By completing this form, you are ensuring that you meet these qualifications.Â Once this has been verified, you will receive more information on how to proceed.Â The parent or guardian in the household (must be 18 years or older) must be the point of contact for this process.

a.span: CLICK HERE TO ACCESS THE FORM TO REQUEST THIS SERVICE

li.span: Â -Â Â Charter (parent company to Spectrum) is offering free access to Spectrum Broadband and Wi-Fi for 60 days for new K-12 and college student households and more.

a.span: CLICK HERE TO FIND OUT MORE ABOUT THIS PROGRAM

li.span: NOTE - Spectrum is currently only available in Jerusalem Township and select nearby locations closely bordering Jerusalem Township.

span.strong: Turning Your Cell Phone Into a WiFi access point

a.span: CLICK HERE TO FIND OUT HOW TO TURN ON YOUR HOTSPOT IF YOU HAVE AN iPHONE

li.span: IF YOU HAVE AN ANDROID PHONE
The steps depend on the manufacturer of your phone, version of Android, and your carrier.Â You will want to check online for instructions specific to these things.

p.span: NOTE - Data rates apply.Â If you are not on unlimited data, please check with your carrier to inquire how this may affect you.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Â

div.div:
OCS Community,Â
Looks like the election will be on for tomorrow as planned. Â Issue 4 is critical to our community and students. Â OCS is working hard supporting our studentsÂ and families in this time of crisis. Â Please exercise your right to vote - OCS Levy! Â #voteOCSIssue4
Thank you! Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS Community,

br.span: Today, the district leadership team met and continued planning for the next three weeks and beyond as our students and faculty work from home.Â This whole situation calls for daily flexibility and short termÂ planning.Â We are purposefully not planning for the long term given the daily changes in mandates and expectations from the State of Ohio and Lucas County Health Department.Â For the next three weeks, here is what we anticipate:

li.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
li.span: Teachers are expected to have regular communication with parents and/or students, which ever is appropriate.Â There are many different methods our staff will use to communicate and by now most parents are aware how their teacher(s)Â two-way communication will occur.Â We are asking parents not to expectÂ communication at all hours of the day but to expect it during the typical school hours.Â Our teachers are committedÂ to your children!

li.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
li.span: We have decided for now, all computer repairs will occur by appointment rather than regular hours.Â This allows for our staff to stay safe but also to support the needs of our students.Â For any device repair request please emailÂ

Â and a technician will schedule an appointment with you.Â If you have not receivedÂ your students device because you child was absent last Friday, you can go to your child's school any day this week between the hours ofÂ
Â Each school office will be open and able to assist you.Â Â

li.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
li.span: For the next three weeks,Â teachers willÂ provideÂ feedbackÂ to students as appropriateÂ andÂ recordÂ all submitted school work and activities.

Â We willÂ ensure there is appropriate record keeping to honorÂ the effort and energy students are applying towards their lessons.Â For the remainder of these three weeks, work will be recorded and may be individually gradedÂ by teachers for feedback, but we have not developed a grading formula to commonlyÂ apply at any grade level or course.Â The work students do will count.Â It is important.Â We need more time to ensure a sound plan forÂ grading is developed and meets the needs of all our students.Â Â

li.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
li.span: Food distribution has begun and will continue based on the needs of our students and families.Â We provided some meals today to local families.Â Moving forward, families need to either contact us directly atÂ
Â or beginning next Monday, go to Starr Elementary between the hours of 10am to noon and receive a full weeks worth of "Grab and Go" breakfast and lunch meals for their children.Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto;margin-left:40px
p.span: We intend to repeat each Monday until further notice.Â See Flyer:Â Â Â Â Â
Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Watch for regular updates.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS Families,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: There are questions related to the access, use, and repair of student devices ourÂ students have.Â Tomorrow morning, our leadership team is meeting to put together some additional procedures on how we will distribute additional devices and many other instructional procedures.Â There will be no student devices distributed tomorrow, Monday, March 16Â but hope to have them available on Tuesday.Â We need a day to finalize our procedures and plans.Â Please be on the look out for an email tomorrow afternoon/evening outlining updated device information and additional information regarding the instructional process moving forward.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: We do have a website specifically for student devices atÂ
Â If you have any usage or repair issues send an email toÂ
.Â We have technicians monitoring this email throughout each school day who can helpÂ you.Â Â Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Again, we appreciate you patience and flexibility as we ban together to educate our students.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS Community,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: One final email for the day.Â On behalf of Oregon City Schools, thank you for your flexibility and understanding as we all navigate through this COVIS-19 pandemic.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: There continues to be many questions which require an answer but we do not have enough information yet to give you an answer.Â In the coming days and weeks we will be addressing questions involving planned field trips, payments, prom, graduation, extended year, communications, athletics, and tech support to name just a few.Â Please be patient with us.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: If you have any questions or a special need you cannot find an answer to, please call our Help Line at 419-698-6030.Â We will be monitoring this every day.Â We want to ensure OCS plays a role in supporting our students while they are not in school.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Again, thank you for your continued support.Â Remember, OCS has a levy on the ballot next Tuesday, March 17, 2020.Â Please exercise your right to vote! It is very important for our community!Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Thank you!Â Â Go Eagles!

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Dear OCS Parents,Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Drescher and Associates Clinical Services (DACS) is committedÂ to ensuring continuityÂ of care for the families we serve in Oregon City Schools. We will be utilizing HIPAA compliant Telehealth sessions and we will be schedulingÂ appointments to take place at our Toledo office for the time that the schools are closed. We will also accept new referralsÂ as needed to ensure we are meeting the needs of the school district. We ask that you take care of yourself and your families during this time and please do not hesitate to cancel appointments if you or your children are sick. We will do our best to accommodate any and all requests for services during this time. Please do not hesitate to reach out to us at 567-218-0185.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Sincerely,Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Aimee Drescher and the DACS team

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS will be monitoring a hotline and email for anyone who may need assistance related to student meals or general questions you cannot find an answer toÂ during this extended school closure.Â Â Thank you and stay safe!

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Email:Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS Community,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Due to COVID-19, all schools will be closed to the public with all public scheduled events either cancelled or relocated off school sites for the next three weeks.Â Based on information we receive from the State of Ohio and Health Department will determine when our schools will reopen for public use.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: I want to thank all the organization leaders who have worked with us and remainedÂ flexibleÂ during this unique time in our history.Â We have awesome community leaders.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Hal

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS Community,

li.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
li.span: Beginning today, the following parameters will apply to district athletics both for Clay HS and Fassett JH.Â Â

li.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
li.span: SportsÂ team practices will continue but only outside and will not be made mandatory for athletes.Â No practices, meetings or gatherings will occur in any of our school indoor facilities.

li.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
li.span: All athletic scrimmages and gamesÂ for at least the next three weeks are cancelled.Â

br.span: If at anytime the OHSAA or State of Ohio make additional recommendations, OCS will review these parameters and make adjustments.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Oregon City Schools

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: OCS Community,

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Wow, what a week.Â Everything we are experiencing is unprecedented and comes with a lot of anxiety and frustration.Â Oregon City Schools will be closed starting Monday, March 16, 2020 as a result of the Ohio Governorâs announcement today to closeÂ all schools for three weeks beginning next week.Â Â Oregon Schools will adhere to the following schedule.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Â - Oregon City Schools will be open as scheduled.Â This will allow students to gather personal belongings and for our school district to send home a Chromebook with each student atÂ all grade levels who do not already have an assigned Chromebook.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Â - Oregon City Schools will be closed for all students.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: 0 - No school due to scheduled spring break for all students.

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Â - All students will return to school as of now.Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: Thank you to all parents, community members and health care providers for helping keep our community safe.Â The future will be very challenging and we need your support more now than ever.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto
p.span: We will continue to provide you communications as our local and state situationsÂ change.Â Â

p.style: caret-color: #000000; font-family: Helvetica; font-size: 12px; text-size-adjust: auto

span.b:
Go Eagles and stay safe!
Hal Gregory, Superintendent
